title: Why can't dogs eat chocolate?

multiple-choice.question: What molecule is responsible for the toxicity of chocolate to pets?
What is the effect of too much theobromine on the human body?

options.label: A
options.text: It makes our hearts pump slower and our muscles get less energy.

options.label: B
options.text: It makes our hearts pump faster, our blood vessels dilate, and our muscles get more energy.

options.label: C
options.text: It causes nausea, convulsions, heart attack, and even death.

options.label: D
options.text: It has no effect on the human body.

multiple-choice.question: Why do humans process theobromine quickly, while pets process it slowly?

options.label: A
options.text: Because humans have evolved to be better at digesting theobromine.

options.label: B
options.text: Because pets have evolved to be better at digesting theobromine.

options.label: C
options.text: Because humans eat more plants than pets.

options.label: D
options.text: Because pets eat more chocolate than humans.

multiple-choice.question: What is the lethal dose of theobromine for a medium-sized dog?

options.label: A
options.text: About five kilograms of dark chocolate.

options.label: B
options.text: About one kilogram of dark chocolate.

options.label: C
options.text: About half of the dog's body weight in milk chocolate.

options.label: D
options.text: About a tenth of a kilogram of dark chocolate.

multiple-choice.question: What is the lethal dose of theobromine for a human?

options.label: A
options.text: About half of the human's body weight in milk chocolate.

options.label: B
options.text: About a tenth of a kilogram of dark chocolate.

options.label: C
options.text: About one kilogram of dark chocolate.

options.label: D
options.text: About five kilograms of milk chocolate.

multiple-choice.question: Why is dark chocolate more toxic to pets than milk chocolate?

options.label: A
options.text: Because dark chocolate contains more theobromine.

options.label: B
options.text: Because milk chocolate contains more theobromine.

options.label: C
options.text: Because dark chocolate is sweeter than milk chocolate.

options.label: D
options.text: Because milk chocolate is sweeter than dark chocolate.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary source of alkaloids?
Why do humans need to eat more chocolate to reach a lethal dose of theobromine than pets?

options.label: A
options.text: Because humans have evolved to be better at digesting theobromine.

options.label: B
options.text: Because pets have evolved to be better at digesting theobromine.

options.label: C
options.text: Because humans eat more plants than pets.

options.label: D
options.text: Because pets eat more chocolate than humans.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of theobromine on the human digestive system?

options.label: A
options.text: It causes nausea, convulsions, heart attack, and even death.

options.label: B
options.text: It makes our hearts pump faster, our blood vessels dilate, and our muscles get more energy.

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on the human digestive system.

options.label: D
options.text: It makes our hearts pump slower and our muscles get less energy.

options.label: A
options.text: Because it is toxic to humans.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it is not good for the human digestive system.

options.text: Because it is not good for pets.
